1.text: Paul, a servant of God, and an apostle of Jesus Christ, according to the faith of God’s elect, and the knowledge of the truth which is according to godliness,

2.text: in hope of eternal life, which God, who cannot lie, promised before times eternal;

3.text: but in his own seasons manifested his word in the message, wherewith I was intrusted according to the commandment of God our Saviour;

4.text: to Titus, my true child after a common faith: Grace and peace from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Saviour.

5.text: For this cause left I thee in Crete, that thou shouldest set in order the things that were wanting, and appoint elders in every city, as I gave thee charge;

6.text: if any man is blameless, the husband of one wife, having children that believe, who are not accused of riot or unruly.

7.text: For the bishop must be blameless, as God’s steward; not selfwilled, not soon angry, no brawler, no striker, not greedy of filthy lucre;

8.text: but given to hospitality, a lover of good, soberminded, just, holy, temperate;

9.text: holding to the faithful word which is according to the teaching, that he may be able both to exhort in the sound doctrine, and to convict the gainsayers.

10.text: For there are many unruly men, vain talkers and deceivers, specially they of the circumcision,

11.text: whose mouths must be stopped; men who overthrow whole houses, teaching things which they ought not, for filthy lucre’s sake.

12.text: One of themselves, a prophet of their own, said, Cretans are alway liars, evil beasts, idle gluttons.

13.text: This testimony is true. For which cause reprove them sharply, that they may be sound in the faith,

14.text: not giving heed to Jewish fables, and commandments of men who turn away from the truth.

15.text: To the pure all things are pure: but to them that are defiled and unbelieving nothing is pure; but both their mind and their conscience are defiled.

16.text: They profess that they know God; but by their works they deny him, being abominable, and disobedient, and unto every good work reprobate.
